conclusion: The suitcase can be pushed or pulled; mass is 15 kg; pull is 90 N; angle θ; g = 10 m/s²; sin 37° = 0.6; resistance proportional to supporting force; find μ and θ.
Image shows suitcase with forces: gravitational force downward, horizontal force to the right, upward force at angle θ.
Calculate force of gravity: Fg = 150 N.
Net horizontal force is zero: Fh = Fpx = 150 N · cos θ.
Upward force Fp = 150 N · sin θ.
Passenger pulls with minimum force of 90 N: Fp = 90 N.
Equate upward force with pull: 150 N · sin θ = 90 N.
Solve for sin θ: sin θ = 0.6.
Angle θ for sin θ = 0.6 is 37°.
Find μ since minimum force is 90 N and resistance is proportional to supporting force.
Calculate horizontal force from resistance: Fr = μ × 150 N.
Net force is zero: Fr = 150 N · cos θ.
Substitute known values: μ × 150 N = 150 N · cos 37°.
